intro: Ficinia anceps, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Asphodelaceae and is characterized by its sword-shaped leaves and tall flowering spikes. The plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has historical significance in Māori culture. Ficinia anceps thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is typically found in coastal and forested areas. Its fibrous leaves have been traditionally used for weaving and crafting.
